channel.title: How do you know if its web 1.0, 2.0, or 3.0?
channel.description:
I been reading everywhere and so far from my understanding web 1.0 is where the users are only able to feed off of information, and 2.0 is where the users are able to feed off of information, socialize, and interect, I dont know about 3.0 but I heard of it.
Like web 1.0 is the basics of html, css, php, javascript, where 2.0 would be ajax, mash up or w/e they called it. I watched this video... I forgot url. Anyways, can anyone tell me how you know when site is 2.0 site???

item.title: How do you know if its web 1.0, 2.0, or 3.0?
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

[quote=“PeeHPee, post:14, topic:270230”][quote author=Cheese_Police link=topic=356652.msg2728064#msg2728064 date=1238516536]
i am using web 4.0
[/quote]
lol noob i am running web web 4¾ owned lol!![/quote]
stfu i bet u run windows 96 lmao wink tongue shifty

Read full topic

If not a bully I sure know you want go off on someone like that on a class questionnaire problem, so thats one reason why I don’t even bother to get started with you kids, and I said kids cuz you act like one. item.title: How do you know if its web 1.0, 2.0, or 3.0?
item.dc:creator: @N00b1 N00b1
item.description:
@N00b1 wrote:

tidy urls is a good place to start also you may want to look at the design. a clean design is normally present. Also you might want to look for a routing system being used with MVC. there’s quite a bit that comes under “web 2.0” being dynamic is a big one also, but ive never bothered with looking at following the guide i just make my web pages and upload

Read full topic
